intro: Metastelma atrovirens, commonly known as the black-green stem vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a dark green upper surface. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
